description: Base 6 expansion uses each positive digit just once.
comments: Leading zeros are permitted. There are a total of 6! = 720 terms in the sequence. - _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 22 2013
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..720
mathematica: Union[ Map[ Plus@@(Array[ (6^#)&, Length[ # ], 0 ]*#)&, Permutations[ Range[ 6-1 ] ] ] ]FromDigits[#,6]&/@Permutations[Range[0,5]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 22 2013 *)

extensions: Keyword "fini" added by _Harvey P. Dale_, Jan 22 2013
